name: Native American Lifelines, Inc.
description: This organization is a Title V Indian Health Services contracted Urban Indian Health Program serving the Baltimore and Boston metropolitan areas. They offer culturally centered behavioral health, dental, outreach, and referral services, including counseling and case management. They do not have a publicly listed rating
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation

name: StrongHearts Native Helpline
description: This is a 24/7 confidential domestic, dating, and sexual violence hotline for American Indians and Alaska Natives. It is not located in Maryland but serves individuals nationwide. Ratings are not applicable to a hotline service
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation

name: Crisis Text Line (for Native communities)
description: This service connects individuals to trained crisis counselors. It is a national service and not specific to Maryland, nor is it a business with a physical address or rating
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation

name: Indian Health Service (IHS) - Rockville, MD
description: The IHS is a federal agency responsible for providing federal health services to American Indians and Alaska Natives. While it offers mental health services and resources, it is a government agency, not a private business, and therefore does not have a rating
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation

name: Maryland Commission on Indian Affairs
description: This commission works to support Native American communities in Maryland. While they may offer referrals to services, they are a state entity, not a business with a rating
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation

name: Cedarville Band of Piscataway Indians
description: This is a tribal organization that may offer resources or referrals for crisis intervention. As a tribal entity, it does not have a business address or rating in the traditional sense
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation

name: Piscataway Conoy Confederacy and Sub-Tribes
description: Similar to the Cedarville Band, this is a tribal organization that may provide or direct individuals to crisis support services
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation

name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
description: This is a national crisis lifeline available 24/7. While it serves everyone, including Native Americans, it is a national service and not a specific business in Maryland
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation

name: Maryland Adult Protective Services Hotline
description: This hotline addresses elder abuse, neglect, and exploitation, which can be a crisis for Native American elders. It is a state service, not a private business
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation

name: Baltimore Crisis Response, Inc. (BCRI)
address: 2000 West Baltimore Street, Baltimore, MD 21223 (Administrative Office)
description: BCRI provides crisis response services in Baltimore City. While not exclusively for Native Americans, they are a key crisis intervention provider in the region. They do not have publicly listed ratings
services: American-Indian-owned Crisis intervention in Maryland consultation
